visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing agricultural production comparison between corn and wheat across major producing countries using pattern fills for categorical distinction

title.text: Corn vs Wheat Estimated Production for 2020 (1000 MT)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional categorical comparisons across six geopolitical entities. Variables consist of nominal country categories (x-axis) and ratio-scale production quantities (y-axis) measured in thousand metric tons. While presented as real-world data through source attribution, values demonstrate intentional contrast design with corn production exceeding wheat in the USA while reversed in China and EU, creating clear comparison anchors. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while maintaining precise value labels. Pattern fills implement Cairo's pre-attentive processing principles for immediate series differentiation without color reliance. Spatial proximity of grouped columns enables direct country-level comparisons, with corn production (μ=151,432) showing greater variance (σ=149,349) than wheat (μ=86,628, σ=53,468) across this country subset.
